examples.yaml_manifest:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: nginx-secure
  labels:
    app: nginx
    security.policy: enforced
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: nginx
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: nginx
    spec:
      securityContext:
        runAsNonRoot: true
        runAsUser: 1000
      containers:
      - name: nginx
        image: nginx:1.21-alpine
        securityContext:
          allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
          readOnlyRootFilesystem: true
        resources:
          requests:
            memory: "64Mi"
            cpu: "250m"
          limits:
            memory: "128Mi"
            cpu: "500m"

apply_final_planning.task_description:
Enhanced kubectl apply command planning with progressive deployment, dependency orchestration, and safety validation. Plan sophisticated deployment strategies with rollback capabilities, validation gates, and security enforcement.

ENHANCED PLANNING CAPABILITIES:
- Progressive rollout strategies with validation gates
- Dependency-aware resource ordering
- Multi-environment deployment orchestration  
- Safety validations and dry-run checkpoints
- Rollback plan integration
- Security policy enforcement
apply_final_planning.examples:
ENHANCED deployment strategies:

Example 1: "Progressive deployment to dev then staging then prod"
â†’ Multi-phase commands with validation gates:
  - Phase 1: kubectl apply --dry-run=server -f manifests/ -n dev
  - Phase 2: kubectl apply -f manifests/ -n dev --wait --timeout=300s
  - Phase 3: kubectl apply --dry-run=server -f manifests/ -n staging  
  - Phase 4: kubectl apply -f manifests/ -n staging --wait --timeout=300s
  - Phase 5: kubectl apply -f manifests/ -n prod --server-side

Example 2: "Deploy with dependency ordering and validation"
â†’ Orchestrated sequence:
  - kubectl apply -f secrets/ -n target --server-side
  - kubectl apply -f configmaps/ -n target --validate=strict
  - kubectl apply -f services/ -n target --wait
  - kubectl apply -f deployments/ -n target --wait --timeout=600s

Example 3: "Canary deployment with monitoring"
â†’ Progressive scaling:
  - kubectl apply -f app-v2/ -n prod --server-side --field-manager=canary
  - kubectl scale deployment/app --replicas=1 -n prod
  - (monitoring validation checkpoint)
  - kubectl scale deployment/app --replicas=5 -n prod
